Swift: Pass By Reference

Thursday, March 19, 2015

Overview

In some cases, you would like to pass a variable by reference. In Swift, we use the inout and the & keys. Hereâ€™s an example of a generic swap.

 1 var lucky = 7
 2 var unlucky = 13
 3 
 4 func swapTwoVariables<T>(inout first: T, inout second: T) {
 5     let temp = first
 6     first = second
 7     second = temp
 8 }
 9 
10 swapTwoVariables(&lucky, &unlucky)
11 
12 println("lucky: \(lucky)   unlucky: \(unlucky)")
13 // "lucky: 13   unlucky: 7"

  • swift 2
  • inout 1
  • reference 1
